column1: '''Dry River''' was the name given to the dry bed of what had once been a tributary of the River [[Sirion]] rising in the [[Encircling Mountains]]. It had joined the Sirion just north of the [[Ford of Brithiach]].<ref>{{S
column2: Map}}</ref>  At the northern end of its gully lay the entrance to the Hidden City of [[Gondolin]].<ref>{{S

column1: In primeval times (before the awakening of the [[Elves]]) the Dry River was filled with water; it drained a lake in the Encircling Mountains.  Once the lake was gone the lake became the valley of [[Tumladen]] and the bed of the Dry River provided a defensible pathway into the hidden area.<ref>{{S
[[Aredhel]] and her son [[Maeglin]], fleeing [[Eöl]], sought and found their way up the Dry River into Gondolin in {{FA
column3: 120}}</ref>.  Unbeknownst to them Eöl followed them, also found the Dry River, and tried to enter Tumladen by stealth.  He was captured and brought to King [[Turgon]].<ref>{{S

column4: 221}}</ref> where they participated in the ''[[Nirnaeth Arnoediad]]''.  When the battle went against the Elves and Men [[Huor]] and [[Húrin]] held back the forces of [[Morgoth]] to allow Turgon to escape.  Turgon's army marched to the Dry River and vanished into the mountains.<ref>{{S
